section.name: Introduction
section.p: OSJava-Threads is an extention of the Threading API that comes with a standard Java SDK. The project started from the inability, under the standard implementation, to access specific Threads in a ThreadGroup, and it grew from there.

This is the initial release of this package under the OSJava-Threads, name. Much has changed from that which it derived, TigThreads. Firstly, the concept of a ThreadGroup is something that should never be used. Instead context objects are used to create, control, and eventaully destroy threads. This context can be implemented as a subcontext of another context, if that's allowed by the parent context. Just bind it in.
Is the OSJava-Threads package done? Hardly. There are still more features that need to be added. See the Pending Tasks (or the Roadmap in the bug pages) for details.
